s0001.chinese: 太史公讀秦楚之際，曰：初作難，發於陳涉；
s0001.literal: When Sima Qian read about the Qin-Chu period, he said: The initial uprising began with Chen She.
s0001.idiomatic: When Sima Qian read about the Qin-Chu period, he said: The initial uprising began with Chen She.

s0002.literal: Tyrannical cruelty destroyed Qin; it came from the Xiang clan.
s0002.idiomatic: Tyrannical cruelty destroyed Qin; it came from the Xiang clan.

s0003.chinese: 撥亂誅暴，平定海內，卒踐帝祚，成於漢家。
s0003.literal: They eliminated chaos and executed tyrants, pacified the realm, finally ascended the imperial throne, accomplished by the Han house.
s0003.idiomatic: They eliminated chaos and executed tyrants, pacified the realm, finally ascended the imperial throne, accomplished by the Han house.

s0004.literal: Within five years, commands and decrees changed three times.
s0004.idiomatic: Within five years, commands and decrees changed three times.

s0005.chinese: 自生民以來，未始有受命若斯之亟
s0005.literal: Since the beginning of human life, never has the reception of the mandate been so urgent as this.
s0005.idiomatic: Since the beginning of human life, never has the reception of the mandate been so urgent as this.

s0006.chinese: 昔虞、夏之興，積善累功數十年，德洽百姓，攝行政事，考之于天，然後在位。
s0006.literal: In ancient times, when Yu and Xia rose to power, they accumulated goodness and achievements for several decades, their virtue permeated the people, they administered government affairs, tested it with Heaven, and then took the throne.
s0006.idiomatic: In ancient times, when Yu and Xia rose to power, they accumulated goodness and achievements for several decades, their virtue permeated the people, they administered government affairs, tested it with Heaven, and then took the throne.

s0007.chinese: 湯、武之王，乃由契、后稷修仁行義十餘世，不期而會孟津八百諸侯，猶以為未可，其后乃放弒。
s0007.literal: When Tang and Wu became kings, it was through Jie and Zhou cultivating benevolence and righteousness for more than ten generations, unexpectedly gathering at Mengjin with eight hundred feudal lords, yet they still considered it not yet possible, and only afterward did they banish and assassinate.
s0007.idiomatic: When Tang and Wu became kings, it was through Jie and Zhou cultivating benevolence and righteousness for more than ten generations, unexpectedly gathering at Mengjin with eight hundred feudal lords, yet they still considered it not yet possible, and only afterward did they banish and assassinate.

s0008.chinese: 秦起襄公，章於文、繆，獻、孝之後，稍以蠶食六國，百有餘載，至始皇乃能并冠帶之倫。
s0008.literal: Qin arose with Duke Xiang, flourished under Wen and Mu, after Xian and Xiao, gradually encroaching on the six states like silkworms eating mulberry leaves, for more than a hundred years, until the First Emperor was able to unite those who wore caps and belts.
s0008.idiomatic: Qin arose with Duke Xiang, flourished under Wen and Mu, after Xian and Xiao, gradually encroaching on the six states like silkworms eating mulberry leaves, for more than a hundred years, until the First Emperor was able to unite those who wore caps and belts.

s0009.chinese: 以德若彼，用力如此，蓋一統若斯之難也。
s0009.literal: With virtue like that, using force like this, indeed unifying is as difficult as this.
s0009.idiomatic: With virtue like that, using force like this, indeed unifying is as difficult as this.

s0010.chinese: 秦既稱帝，患兵革不休，以有諸侯也，於是無尺土之封，墮壞名城，銷鋒鏑，鉏豪桀，維萬世之安。
s0010.literal: After Qin declared itself emperor, it worried that weapons would never cease because of the feudal lords, therefore there were no enfeoffments of even a foot of land, famous cities were demolished, weapons were melted down, powerful nobles were eliminated, to maintain peace for ten thousand generations.
s0010.idiomatic: After Qin declared itself emperor, it worried that weapons would never cease because of the feudal lords, therefore there were no enfeoffments of even a foot of land, famous cities were demolished, weapons were melted down, powerful nobles were eliminated, to maintain peace for ten thousand generations.

s0011.chinese: 然王跡之興，起於閭巷，合從討伐，軼於三代，鄉秦之禁，適足以資賢者為驅除難耳。
s0011.literal: Yet the rise of royal traces begins in alleyways, allied coalitions attack, surpassing the Three Dynasties, the Qin prohibitions actually only served to provide resources for the worthy to eliminate difficulties.
s0011.idiomatic: Yet the rise of royal traces begins in alleyways, allied coalitions attack, surpassing the Three Dynasties, the Qin prohibitions actually only served to provide resources for the worthy to eliminate difficulties.

s0012.chinese: 故憤發其所為天下雄，安在無土不王。
s0012.literal: Therefore they were enraged at what made them hegemon of the realm, how could they not become king without territory?
s0012.idiomatic: Therefore they were enraged at what made them hegemon of the realm, how could they not become king without territory?

s0013.literal: Is this not what the transmissions call a great sage?
s0013.idiomatic: Is this not what the transmissions call a great sage?

s0014.literal: Is it not Heaven? Is it not Heaven!
s0014.idiomatic: Is it not Heaven? Is it not Heaven!

s0015.chinese: 非大聖孰能當此受命而帝者乎？
s0015.literal: Who but a great sage could receive this mandate and become emperor?
s0015.idiomatic: Who but a great sage could receive this mandate and become emperor?

s26.literal: Second year of the Second Emperor
s26.idiomatic: Second year of the Second Emperor

s37.literal: Chu Yin Wang Chen Sheng rose in rebellion and entered Qin
s37.idiomatic: Chu Yin Wang Chen Sheng rose in rebellion and entered Qin

s47.chinese: 二。葛嬰為涉徇九江，立襄彊為楚王。
s47.literal: Second. Ge Ying toured Jiujiang for Chen Sheng and established Xiang Qiang as Chu king
s47.idiomatic: Second. Ge Ying toured Jiujiang for Chen Sheng and established Xiang Qiang as Chu king

s49.chinese: 武臣始至邯鄲，自立為趙王，始。
s49.literal: Wu Chen first arrived at Handan, established himself as Zhao king, beginning.
s49.idiomatic: Wu Chen first arrived at Handan, established himself as Zhao king, beginning.

s56.literal: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived at Xi.
s56.idiomatic: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived at Xi.

s57.chinese: 三。周文兵至戲，敗。而葛嬰聞涉王，即殺彊。
s57.literal: Third. Zhou Wen's troops arrived at Xi and were defeated. Ge Ying heard that Chen Sheng had become king and immediately killed Qiang.
s57.idiomatic: Third. Zhou Wen's troops arrived at Xi and were defeated. Ge Ying heard that Chen Sheng had become king and immediately killed Qiang.

s58.literal: Xiang Liang was titled Wu Xin Jun.
s58.idiomatic: Xiang Liang was titled Wu Xin Jun.

s60.chinese: 齊王田儋始。儋，狄人。諸田宗彊。從弟榮，榮弟橫。
s60.literal: Qi King Tian Dan beginning. Dan was a Di tribesman. The various Tian clan honored Qiang. Younger brother Rong, Rong's younger brother Heng.
s60.idiomatic: Qi King Tian Dan beginning. Dan was a Di tribesman. The various Tian clan honored Qiang. Younger brother Rong, Rong's younger brother Heng.

s61.literal: Pei Gong first rose in rebellion.
s61.idiomatic: Pei Gong first rose in rebellion.

s62.chinese: 韓廣為趙略地至薊，自立為燕王始。
s62.literal: Han Guang campaigned for Zhao, reaching Ji, established himself as Yan king, beginning.
s62.idiomatic: Han Guang campaigned for Zhao, reaching Ji, established himself as Yan king, beginning.

s63.chinese: 魏王咎始。咎在陳，不得歸國。
s63.literal: Wei King Jiu beginning. Jiu was in Chen and could not return to his state.
s63.idiomatic: Wei King Jiu beginning. Jiu was in Chen and could not return to his state.

s70.literal: Second. Dan rose in rebellion, killed the Di magistrate, and proclaimed himself king.
s70.idiomatic: Second. Dan rose in rebellion, killed the Di magistrate, and proclaimed himself king.

s71.chinese: 二。擊胡陵、方與，破秦監軍。
s71.literal: Second. Attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, defeated Qin army supervisors.
s71.idiomatic: Second. Attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, defeated Qin army supervisors.

s79.chinese: 四。李良殺武臣，張耳、陳餘走。
s79.literal: Fourth. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er and Chen Yu fled
s79.idiomatic: Fourth. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er and Chen Yu fled

s81.chinese: 三。殺泗水守。拔薛西。周市東略地豐沛閒。
s81.literal: Third. Killed the Si Shui magistrate. Took Xishuai. Zhou Shi campaigned east between Feng and Pei
s81.idiomatic: Third. Killed the Si Shui magistrate. Took Xishuai. Zhou Shi campaigned east between Feng and Pei

s83.chinese: 三。齊、趙共立周市，市不肯，曰「必立魏咎」云。
s83.literal: Third. Qi and Zhao jointly established Zhou Shi, but Shi refused, saying 'We must establish Wei Jiu'
s83.idiomatic: Third. Qi and Zhao jointly established Zhou Shi, but Shi refused, saying 'We must establish Wei Jiu'

s91.chinese: 四。雍齒叛沛公，以豐降魏。沛公還攻豐，不能下。
s91.literal: Fourth. Yong Chi rebelled against Pei Gong, surrendered Feng to Wei. Pei Gong returned to attack Feng but could not take it
s91.idiomatic: Fourth. Yong Chi rebelled against Pei Gong, surrendered Feng to Wei. Pei Gong returned to attack Feng but could not take it

s93.literal: Fourth. Jiu returned from Chen and was established
s93.idiomatic: Fourth. Jiu returned from Chen and was established

s97.literal: Chu King Jing Ke beginning, Qin Jia established him
s97.idiomatic: Chu King Jing Ke beginning, Qin Jia established him

s98.chinese: 五。涉將召平矯拜項梁為楚柱國，急西擊秦。
s98.literal: Fifth. Chen Sheng's general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu Zhu Guo and urgently attacked west against Qin
s98.idiomatic: Fifth. Chen Sheng's general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu Zhu Guo and urgently attacked west against Qin

s99.chinese: 趙王歇始，張耳、陳餘立之。
s99.literal: Zhao King Xie beginning, Zhang Er and Chen Yu established him
s99.idiomatic: Zhao King Xie beginning, Zhang Er and Chen Yu established him

s100.chinese: 五。讓景駒以擅自王不請我。
s100.literal: Fifth. Reprimanded Jing Ke for presumptuously becoming king without consulting us
s100.idiomatic: Fifth. Reprimanded Jing Ke for presumptuously becoming king without consulting us

s101.chinese: 五。沛公聞景駒王在留，往從，與擊秦軍碭西。
s101.literal: Fifth. Pei Gong heard Jing Ke was king in Liu, went to join him, and together attacked Qin troops west of Dang
s101.idiomatic: Fifth. Pei Gong heard Jing Ke was king in Liu, went to join him, and together attacked Qin troops west of Dang

s103.chinese: 五。章邯已破涉，圍咎臨濟。
s103.literal: Fifth. Zhang Han had defeated Chen Sheng and besieged Jiu at Lin Ji
s103.idiomatic: Fifth. Zhang Han had defeated Chen Sheng and besieged Jiu at Lin Ji

s108.chinese: 六。梁渡江，陳嬰、黥布皆屬。
s108.literal: Sixth. Liang crossed the Jiang, Chen Ying and Qing Bu all joined him
s108.idiomatic: Sixth. Liang crossed the Jiang, Chen Ying and Qing Bu all joined him

s110.chinese: 六。景駒使公孫慶讓齊，誅慶。
s110.literal: Sixth. Jing Ke sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing
s110.idiomatic: Sixth. Jing Ke sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing

s111.chinese: 六。攻下碭，收得兵六千，與故凡九千人。
s111.literal: Sixth. Attacked and took Dang, obtained six thousand troops, together with previous forces totaling nine thousand
s111.idiomatic: Sixth. Attacked and took Dang, obtained six thousand troops, together with previous forces totaling nine thousand

s121.chinese: 七。攻拔下邑，遂擊豐，豐不拔。聞項梁兵眾，往請擊豐。
s121.literal: Seventh. Attacked and took Xiayi, then attacked Feng, but Feng did not fall. Heard Xiang Liang had many troops, went to request him to attack Feng.
s121.idiomatic: Seventh. Attacked and took Xiayi, then attacked Feng, but Feng did not fall. Heard Xiang Liang had many troops, went to request him to attack Feng.

s128.chinese: 八。梁擊殺景駒、秦嘉，遂入薛，兵十餘萬眾。
s128.literal: Eighth. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ke and Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops numbering over one hundred thousand.
s128.idiomatic: Eighth. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ke and Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops numbering over one hundred thousand.

s131.chinese: 八。沛公如薛見項梁，梁益沛公卒五千，擊豐，拔之。雍齒奔魏。
s131.literal: Eighth. Pei Gong went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei Gong's troops by five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.
s131.idiomatic: Eighth. Pei Gong went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei Gong's troops by five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.

s133.chinese: 八。臨濟急，周市如齊、楚請救。
s133.literal: Eighth. Lin Ji was in crisis, Zhou Shi went to Qi and Chu to request aid.
s133.idiomatic: Eighth. Lin Ji was in crisis, Zhou Shi went to Qi and Chu to request aid.

s147.chinese: 楚懷王始，都盱台，故懷王孫，梁立之。
s147.literal: Chu Huai Wang beginning, capital at Xutai, former Huai Wang's grandson, Liang established him.
s147.idiomatic: Chu Huai Wang beginning, capital at Xutai, former Huai Wang's grandson, Liang established him.

s148.chinese: 十。梁求楚懷王孫，得之民閒，立為楚王。
s148.literal: Tenth. Liang sought the Chu Huai Wang's grandson, found him among the common people, established him as Chu king.
s148.idiomatic: Tenth. Liang sought the Chu Huai Wang's grandson, found him among the common people, established him as Chu king.

s150.chinese: 十。儋救臨濟，章邯殺田儋。榮走東阿。
s150.literal: Tenth. Dan rescued Lin Ji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled to Dong'e.
s150.idiomatic: Tenth. Dan rescued Lin Ji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled to Dong'e.

s151.chinese: 十。沛公如薛，共立楚懷王。
s151.literal: Tenth. Pei Gong went to Xue and together established Chu Huai Wang.
s151.idiomatic: Tenth. Pei Gong went to Xue and together established Chu Huai Wang.

s153.literal: Tenth. Jiu committed suicide, Lin Ji surrendered to Qin.
s153.idiomatic: Tenth. Jiu committed suicide, Lin Ji surrendered to Qin.

s157.literal: Second. Chen Ying became Zhu Guo.
s157.idiomatic: Second. Chen Ying became Zhu Guo.

s158.chinese: 十一。天大雨，三月不見星。
s158.literal: Eleventh. Great rain, for three months stars were not seen.
s158.idiomatic: Eleventh. Great rain, for three months stars were not seen.

s160.chinese: 齊立田假為王，秦急圍東阿。
s160.literal: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently besieged Dong'e.
s160.idiomatic: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently besieged Dong'e.

s161.chinese: 十一。沛公與項羽北救東阿，破秦軍濮陽，東屠城陽。
s161.literal: Eleventh. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu went north to rescue Dong'e, defeated Qin army at Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.
s161.idiomatic: Eleventh. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu went north to rescue Dong'e, defeated Qin army at Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.

s163.literal: Jiu's younger brother Bao fled to Dong'e.
s163.idiomatic: Jiu's younger brother Bao fled to Dong'e.

s168.chinese: 十二。救東阿，破秦軍，乘勝至定陶，項梁有驕色。
s168.literal: Twelfth. Rescued Dong'e, defeated Qin army, following victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang showed arrogance.
s168.idiomatic: Twelfth. Rescued Dong'e, defeated Qin army, following victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang showed arrogance.

s170.chinese: 楚救榮，得解歸，逐田假，立儋子市為齊王，始。
s170.literal: Chu rescued Rong, who was able to return, drove out Tian Jia, established Dan's son Shi as Qi king, beginning.
s170.idiomatic: Chu rescued Rong, who was able to return, drove out Tian Jia, established Dan's son Shi as Qi king, beginning.

s171.chinese: 十二。沛公與項羽西略地，斬三川守李由於雍丘。
s171.literal: Twelfth. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu campaigned west, executed the Sanchuan magistrate Li You at Yongqiu.
s171.idiomatic: Twelfth. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu campaigned west, executed the Sanchuan magistrate Li You at Yongqiu.

s178.chinese: 十三。章邯破殺項梁於定陶，項羽恐，還軍彭城。
s178.literal: Thirteenth. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu was afraid, returned army to Pengcheng.
s178.idiomatic: Thirteenth. Zhang Han defeated and killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao, Xiang Yu was afraid, returned army to Pengcheng.

s180.chinese: 二。田假走楚，楚趨齊救趙。田榮以假故，不肯，謂「楚殺假乃出兵。」項羽怒田榮。
s180.literal: Second. Tian Jia fled to Chu, Chu hurried to Qi to rescue Zhao. Tian Rong refused because of Jia, saying 'Chu must kill Jia before I send troops.' Xiang Yu was angry at Tian Rong.
s180.idiomatic: Second. Tian Jia fled to Chu, Chu hurried to Qi to rescue Zhao. Tian Rong refused because of Jia, saying 'Chu must kill Jia before I send troops.' Xiang Yu was angry at Tian Rong.

s181.chinese: 十三。沛公聞項梁死，還軍，從懷王，軍於碭。
s181.literal: Thirteenth. Pei Gong heard Xiang Liang was dead, returned army, followed Huai Wang, encamped at Dang.
s181.idiomatic: Thirteenth. Pei Gong heard Xiang Liang was dead, returned army, followed Huai Wang, encamped at Dang.

s183.chinese: 魏豹自立為魏王，都平陽，始。
s183.literal: Wei Bao established himself as Wei king, capital at Pingyang, beginning.
s183.idiomatic: Wei Bao established himself as Wei king, capital at Pingyang, beginning.

s187.literal: Fifth. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.
s187.idiomatic: Fifth. Appointed Song Yi as supreme general.

s188.chinese: 懷王封項羽於魯，為次將，屬宋義，北救趙。
s188.literal: Huai Wang enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, as deputy general, subordinate to Song Yi, north to rescue Zhao.
s188.idiomatic: Huai Wang enfeoffed Xiang Yu at Lu, as deputy general, subordinate to Song Yi, north to rescue Zhao.

s189.chinese: 十。秦軍圍歇鉅鹿，陳餘出收兵。
s189.literal: Tenth. Qin army besieged Xie at Julu, Chen Yu went out to gather troops.
s189.idiomatic: Tenth. Qin army besieged Xie at Julu, Chen Yu went out to gather troops.

s191.chinese: 十四。懷王封沛公為武安侯，將碭郡兵西，約先至咸陽王之。
s191.literal: Fourteenth. Huai Wang enfeoffed Pei Gong as Wu'an Hou, commanding Dang commandery troops west, agreed that first to reach Xianyang would be king there.
s191.idiomatic: Fourteenth. Huai Wang enfeoffed Pei Gong as Wu'an Hou, commanding Dang commandery troops west, agreed that first to reach Xianyang would be king there.

s199.chinese: 十一。章邯破邯鄲，徙其民於河內。
s199.literal: Eleventh. Zhang Han defeated Handan, moved its people to Henei.
s199.idiomatic: Eleventh. Zhang Han defeated Handan, moved its people to Henei.

s200.chinese: 四。齊將田都叛榮，往助項羽救趙。
s200.literal: Fourth. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.
s200.idiomatic: Fourth. Qi general Tian Du rebelled against Rong, went to assist Xiang Yu rescue Zhao.

s201.chinese: 十五。攻破東郡尉及王離軍於成武南。
s201.literal: Fifteenth. Attacked and broke Dong commandery wei and Wang Li's army south of Chengwu.
s201.idiomatic: Fifteenth. Attacked and broke Dong commandery wei and Wang Li's army south of Chengwu.

s202.literal: Fifteenth. Sent general Zang Tu to rescue Zhao.
s202.idiomatic: Fifteenth. Sent general Zang Tu to rescue Zhao.

s207.literal: Seventh. Appointed Ji as supreme general.
s207.idiomatic: Seventh. Appointed Ji as supreme general.

s208.chinese: 三。羽矯殺宋義，將其兵渡河救鉅鹿。
s208.literal: Third. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, took his troops and crossed the river to rescue Julu.
s208.idiomatic: Third. Yu falsely killed Song Yi, took his troops and crossed the river to rescue Julu.

s218.chinese: 四。大破秦軍鉅鹿下，諸侯將皆屬項羽。
s218.literal: Fourth. Greatly defeated Qin army below Julu, all the lords' generals joined Xiang Yu.
s218.idiomatic: Fourth. Greatly defeated Qin army below Julu, all the lords' generals joined Xiang Yu.

s219.literal: Thirteenth. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted.
s219.idiomatic: Thirteenth. Chu rescue arrived, Qin siege lifted.

s220.chinese: 六。故齊王建孫田安下濟北，從項羽救趙。
s220.literal: Sixth. Former Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An came down from Jibei, followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.
s220.idiomatic: Sixth. Former Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An came down from Jibei, followed Xiang Yu to rescue Zhao.

s221.chinese: 十七。（救趙）至栗，得皇訢、武蒲軍。與秦軍戰，破之。
s221.literal: Seventeenth. (Rescuing Zhao) arrived at Li, obtained Huang Xin and Wu Pu's armies. Fought with Qin army, defeated them.
s221.idiomatic: Seventeenth. (Rescuing Zhao) arrived at Li, obtained Huang Xin and Wu Pu's armies. Fought with Qin army, defeated them.

s228.literal: Fifth. Captured Qin general Wang Li.
s228.idiomatic: Fifth. Captured Qin general Wang Li.

s229.chinese: 十四。張耳怒陳餘，棄將印去。
s229.literal: Fourteenth. Zhang Er was angry at Chen Yu, abandoned his general's seal and left.
s229.idiomatic: Fourteenth. Zhang Er was angry at Chen Yu, abandoned his general's seal and left.

s238.literal: Sixth. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han's army retreated.
s238.idiomatic: Sixth. Attacked and broke Zhang Han, Zhang Han's army retreated.

s241.chinese: 十九。得彭越軍昌邑，襲陳留。用酈食其策，軍得積粟。
s241.literal: Nineteenth. Obtained Peng Yue's army at Changyi, attacked Chenliu. Using Li Yiji's strategy, army obtained accumulated grain.
s241.idiomatic: Nineteenth. Obtained Peng Yue's army at Changyi, attacked Chenliu. Using Li Yiji's strategy, army obtained accumulated grain.

s251.chinese: 二十。攻開封，破秦將楊熊，熊走滎陽，秦斬熊以徇。
s251.literal: Twentieth. Attacked Kaifeng, defeated Qin general Yang Xiong, Xiong fled to Xingyang, Qin executed Xiong to display.
s251.idiomatic: Twentieth. Attacked Kaifeng, defeated Qin general Yang Xiong, Xiong fled to Xingyang, Qin executed Xiong to display.

s258.chinese: 八。楚急攻章邯，章邯恐，使長史欣歸秦請兵，趙高讓之。
s258.literal: Eighth. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han, Zhang Han was afraid, sent chief clerk Xin back to Qin to request troops, Zhao Gao obstructed him.
s258.idiomatic: Eighth. Chu urgently attacked Zhang Han, Zhang Han was afraid, sent chief clerk Xin back to Qin to request troops, Zhao Gao obstructed him.

s261.chinese: 二十一。攻潁陽，略韓地，北絕河津。
s261.literal: Twenty-first. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han territory, north cut off the river crossing.
s261.idiomatic: Twenty-first. Attacked Yingyang, raided Han territory, north cut off the river crossing.

s268.chinese: 九。趙高欲誅欣，欣恐，亡走，告章邯謀叛秦。
s268.literal: Ninth. Zhao Gao wanted to execute Xin, Xin was afraid, fled, informed Zhang Han of plotting rebellion against Qin.
s268.idiomatic: Ninth. Zhao Gao wanted to execute Xin, Xin was afraid, fled, informed Zhang Han of plotting rebellion against Qin.

s278.chinese: 十。章邯與楚約降，未定，項羽許而擊之。
s278.literal: Tenth. Zhang Han agreed to surrender to Chu, not yet decided, Xiang Yu promised and then attacked him.
s278.idiomatic: Tenth. Zhang Han agreed to surrender to Chu, not yet decided, Xiang Yu promised and then attacked him.

s281.chinese: 二十三。攻南陽守齮，破之陽城郭東。
s281.literal: Twenty-third. Attacked Nanyang magistrate Yi, defeated him east of Yangcheng walls.
s281.idiomatic: Twenty-third. Attacked Nanyang magistrate Yi, defeated him east of Yangcheng walls.

s288.chinese: 十一。項羽與章邯期殷虛，章邯等已降，與盟，以邯為雍王。
s288.literal: Eleventh. Xiang Yu made an appointment with Zhang Han at Yin Xu, Zhang Han and others had already surrendered, made alliance with them, made Han Yong king.
s288.idiomatic: Eleventh. Xiang Yu made an appointment with Zhang Han at Yin Xu, Zhang Han and others had already surrendered, made alliance with them, made Han Yong king.

s291.chinese: 二十四。降下南陽，封其守齮。
s291.literal: Twenty-fourth. Surrendered and pacified Nanyang, enfeoffed its magistrate Yi.
s291.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth. Surrendered and pacified Nanyang, enfeoffed its magistrate Yi.

s294.literal: Fifteenth. Shen Yang pacified Henan, surrendered to Chu.
s294.idiomatic: Fifteenth. Shen Yang pacified Henan, surrendered to Chu.

s296.literal: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor.
s296.idiomatic: Eighth month. Zhao Gao killed the Second Emperor.

s298.chinese: 十二。以秦降都尉翳、長史欣為上將，將秦降軍。
s298.literal: Twelfth. Made surrendered Qin duwei Yi and chief clerk Xin supreme generals, commanding surrendered Qin troops.
s298.idiomatic: Twelfth. Made surrendered Qin duwei Yi and chief clerk Xin supreme generals, commanding surrendered Qin troops.

s299.chinese: 二十一。趙王歇留國。陳餘亡居南皮。
s299.literal: Twenty-first. Zhao King Xie remained in his state. Chen Yu fled and dwelt in Nanpi.
s299.idiomatic: Twenty-first. Zhao King Xie remained in his state. Chen Yu fled and dwelt in Nanpi.

s311.chinese: 二十六。攻下嶢及藍田。以留侯策，不戰皆降。
s311.literal: Twenty-sixth. Attacked and took Ao and Lantian. Using Liu Hou's strategy, without battle all surrendered.
s311.idiomatic: Twenty-sixth. Attacked and took Ao and Lantian. Using Liu Hou's strategy, without battle all surrendered.

s318.chinese: 十四。項羽將諸侯兵四十餘萬，行略地，西至於河南。
s318.literal: Fourteenth. Xiang Yu led the lords' troops, over four hundred thousand, marched raiding territory, west to Henan.
s318.idiomatic: Fourteenth. Xiang Yu led the lords' troops, over four hundred thousand, marched raiding territory, west to Henan.

s319.chinese: 二十三。張耳從楚西入秦。
s319.literal: Twenty-third. Zhang Er followed Chu west into Qin.
s319.idiomatic: Twenty-third. Zhang Er followed Chu west into Qin.

s321.chinese: 二十七。漢元年，秦王子嬰降。沛公入破咸陽，平秦，還軍霸上，待諸侯約。
s321.literal: Twenty-seventh. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered and broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army to Bashang, awaited the lords' agreement.
s321.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh. Han first year, Qin prince Ziying surrendered. Pei Gong entered and broke Xianyang, pacified Qin, returned army to Bashang, awaited the lords' agreement.

s323.chinese: 十五。從項羽略地，遂入關
s323.literal: Fifteenth. Followed Xiang Yu raiding territory, then entered the pass.
s323.idiomatic: Fifteenth. Followed Xiang Yu raiding territory, then entered the pass.

s328.chinese: 十五。羽詐阬殺秦降卒二十萬人於新安。
s328.literal: Fifteenth. Yu falsely pit-killed two hundred thousand surrendered Qin soldiers at Xin'an.
s328.idiomatic: Fifteenth. Yu falsely pit-killed two hundred thousand surrendered Qin soldiers at Xin'an.

s331.chinese: 二十八。沛公出令三章，秦民大悅。
s331.literal: Twenty-eighth. Pei Gong issued the three chapter command, Qin people greatly pleased.
s331.idiomatic: Twenty-eighth. Pei Gong issued the three chapter command, Qin people greatly pleased.

s338.chinese: 十六。至關中，誅秦王子嬰，屠燒咸陽。分天下，立諸侯。
s338.literal: Sixteenth. Arrived in Guanzhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred and burned Xianyang. Divided the empire, established the lords.
s338.idiomatic: Sixteenth. Arrived in Guanzhong, executed Qin prince Ziying, massacred and burned Xianyang. Divided the empire, established the lords.

s339.literal: Twenty-fifth. Divided Zhao into Dai state.
s339.idiomatic: Twenty-fifth. Divided Zhao into Dai state.

s340.chinese: 十八。項羽怨榮，分齊為三國。
s340.literal: Eighteenth. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.
s340.idiomatic: Eighteenth. Xiang Yu resented Rong, divided Qi into three states.

s341.chinese: 二十九。與項羽有纳，見之戲下，講解。羽倍約，分關中為四國。
s341.literal: Twenty-ninth. Had a falling out with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, reconciled. Yu broke the agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.
s341.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth. Had a falling out with Xiang Yu, met him below Xi, reconciled. Yu broke the agreement, divided Guanzhong into four states.

s342.chinese: 二十九。臧荼從入，分燕為二國。
s342.literal: Twenty-ninth. Zang Tu followed and entered, divided Yan into two states.
s342.idiomatic: Twenty-ninth. Zang Tu followed and entered, divided Yan into two states.

s343.literal: Seventeenth. Divided Wei into Yin state.
s343.idiomatic: Seventeenth. Divided Wei into Yin state.

s344.literal: Twentieth. Divided Han into Henan state.
s344.idiomatic: Twentieth. Divided Han into Henan state.

s367.chinese: 九。義帝元年。諸侯尊懷王為義帝。
s367.literal: Ninth. Yi Di first year. The lords honored Huai Wang as Yi Di.
s367.idiomatic: Ninth. Yi Di first year. The lords honored Huai Wang as Yi Di.

s368.chinese: 十七。項籍自立為西楚霸王。
s368.literal: Seventeenth. Xiang Ji established himself as Western Chu Overlord.
s368.idiomatic: Seventeenth. Xiang Ji established himself as Western Chu Overlord.

s377.literal: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.
s377.idiomatic: First month. Divided Guanzhong into Han.

s388.literal: Second. Moved capital to Chenzhou south of the Jiang.
s388.idiomatic: Second. Moved capital to Chenzhou south of the Jiang.

s389.chinese: 西楚主伯，項籍始，為天下主命，主十八王。
s389.literal: Western Chu lorded over the dukes, Xiang Ji beginning, commanded the empire's fate, controlled eighteen kings.
s389.idiomatic: Western Chu lorded over the dukes, Xiang Ji beginning, commanded the empire's fate, controlled eighteen kings.

s390.literal: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord.
s390.idiomatic: King Wu Rui beginning, former Fan lord.

s391.literal: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu Zhu Guo.
s391.idiomatic: King Gong Ao beginning, former Chu Zhu Guo.

s392.literal: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general.
s392.idiomatic: King Ying Bu beginning, former Chu general.

s393.literal: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general.
s393.idiomatic: King Zhang Er beginning, former Chu general.

s394.chinese: 二十七。。王趙歇始，故趙王。
s394.literal: Twenty-seventh. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king.
s394.idiomatic: Twenty-seventh. King Zhao Xie beginning, former Zhao king.

s395.literal: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general.
s395.idiomatic: King Tian Du beginning, former Qi general.

s396.literal: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general.
s396.idiomatic: King Tian An beginning, former Qi general.

s397.literal: Twentieth. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king.
s397.idiomatic: Twentieth. King Tian Shi beginning, former Qi king.

s398.literal: Second month. Han King beginning, former Pei Gong.
s398.idiomatic: Second month. Han King beginning, former Pei Gong.

s399.literal: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general.
s399.idiomatic: King Zhang Han beginning, former Qin general.

s400.literal: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general.
s400.idiomatic: King Sima Xin beginning, former Qin general.

s401.literal: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general.
s401.idiomatic: King Dong Yi beginning, former Qin general.

s402.literal: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general.
s402.idiomatic: King Zang Tu beginning, former Yan general.

s403.chinese: 三十一。王韓廣始，故燕王。
s403.literal: Thirty-first. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king.
s403.idiomatic: Thirty-first. King Han Guang beginning, former Yan king.

s404.literal: Nineteenth. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king.
s404.idiomatic: Nineteenth. King Wei Bao beginning, former Wei king.

s405.literal: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general.
s405.idiomatic: King Sima Ang beginning, former Zhao general.

s406.chinese: 二十二。王韓成始，故韓將。
s406.literal: Twenty-second. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general.
s406.idiomatic: Twenty-second. King Han Cheng beginning, former Han general.

s407.literal: King Shen Yang beginning, former Chu general.
s407.idiomatic: King Shen Yang beginning, former Chu general.

s431.chinese: 三。諸侯罷戲下兵，皆之國。
s431.literal: Third. The lords disbanded troops below Xi, all returned to their states.
s431.idiomatic: Third. The lords disbanded troops below Xi, all returned to their states.

s458.literal: Fourth. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu.
s458.idiomatic: Fourth. Tian Rong attacked Du, Du surrendered to Chu.

s479.literal: Qi King Tian Rong beginning, former Qi chancellor.
s479.idiomatic: Qi King Tian Rong beginning, former Qi chancellor.

s481.literal: Twenty-fourth. Tian Rong attacked and killed Shi.
s481.idiomatic: Twenty-fourth. Tian Rong attacked and killed Shi.

s501.literal: Sixth. Tian Rong attacked and killed An.
s501.idiomatic: Sixth. Tian Rong attacked and killed An.

s525.literal: Seventh. Han defended Fei Qiu, Han surrounded it.
s525.idiomatic: Seventh. Han defended Fei Qiu, Han surrounded it.

s526.literal: Seventh. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
s526.idiomatic: Seventh. Xin surrendered to Han, state eliminated.

s527.literal: Seventh. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated.
s527.idiomatic: Seventh. Yi surrendered to Han, state eliminated.

s529.chinese: 三十七。臧荼擊廣無終，滅之。
s529.literal: Thirty-seventh. Zang Tu attacked Guang at Wuzhong, extinguished it.
s529.idiomatic: Thirty-seventh. Zang Tu attacked Guang at Wuzhong, extinguished it.

s532.literal: Han King Zheng Chang beginning, Xiang Yu established him.
s532.idiomatic: Han King Zheng Chang beginning, Xiang Yu established him.

s547.literal: Attached to Han, became Weinan and Heshang commanderies.
s547.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Weinan and Heshang commanderies.

s548.literal: Attached to Han as Shang commandery.
s548.idiomatic: Attached to Han as Shang commandery.

s556.literal: Tenth. Xiang Yu extinguished Yi Di.
s556.idiomatic: Tenth. Xiang Yu extinguished Yi Di.

s562.literal: Thirty-fifth. Xie again became king of Zhao.
s562.idiomatic: Thirty-fifth. Xie again became king of Zhao.

s566.literal: Tenth month. King arrived at Shan.
s566.idiomatic: Tenth month. King arrived at Shan.

s595.literal: Han King Xin beginning, Han established him.
s595.idiomatic: Han King Xin beginning, Han established him.

s596.literal: Attached to Han, became Henan commandery.
s596.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Henan commandery.

s603.chinese: 歇以陳餘為代王，故成安君。
s603.literal: Xie made Chen Yu Dai king, former Cheng'an Jun.
s603.idiomatic: Xie made Chen Yu Dai king, former Cheng'an Jun.

s626.chinese: 八。項籍擊榮，走平原平原民殺之。
s626.literal: Eighth. Xiang Ji attacked Rong, fled to Pingyuan where Pingyuan people killed him.
s626.idiomatic: Eighth. Xiang Ji attacked Rong, fled to Pingyuan where Pingyuan people killed him.

s647.chinese: 項籍立故齊王田假為齊王。
s647.literal: Xiang Ji established former Qi King Tian Jia as Qi king.
s647.idiomatic: Xiang Ji established former Qi King Tian Jia as Qi king.

s668.chinese: 二。田榮弟橫反城陽，擊假，走楚，楚殺假。
s668.literal: Second. Tian Rong's younger brother Heng rebelled at Chengyang, attacked Jia, fled to Chu, Chu killed Jia.
s668.idiomatic: Second. Tian Rong's younger brother Heng rebelled at Chengyang, attacked Jia, fled to Chu, Chu killed Jia.

s678.literal: Fourteenth. Surrendered to Han, Ang deposed.
s678.idiomatic: Fourteenth. Surrendered to Han, Ang deposed.

s683.chinese: 三。項羽以兵三萬破漢兵五十六萬。
s683.literal: Third. Xiang Yu with thirty thousand troops defeated five hundred sixty thousand Han troops.
s683.idiomatic: Third. Xiang Yu with thirty thousand troops defeated five hundred sixty thousand Han troops.

s689.chinese: 齊王田廣始。廣，榮子，橫立之。
s689.literal: Qi King Tian Guang beginning. Guang was Rong's son, established by Heng.
s689.idiomatic: Qi King Tian Guang beginning. Guang was Rong's son, established by Heng.

s692.chinese: 四月。王伐楚至彭城，壞走。
s692.literal: Fourth month. King invaded Chu to Pengcheng, suffered defeat and fled.
s692.idiomatic: Fourth month. King invaded Chu to Pengcheng, suffered defeat and fled.

s698.literal: Thirty-third. Followed Han to attack Chu.
s698.idiomatic: Thirty-third. Followed Han to attack Chu.

s699.literal: Became Henei commandery, attached to Han.
s699.idiomatic: Became Henei commandery, attached to Han.

s700.literal: Sixth. Followed Han to attack Chu.
s700.idiomatic: Sixth. Followed Han to attack Chu.

s713.literal: Fifth month. King fled to Xingyang.
s713.idiomatic: Fifth month. King fled to Xingyang.

s719.literal: Thirty-fourth. Bao returned, rebelled against Han.
s719.idiomatic: Thirty-fourth. Bao returned, rebelled against Han.

s734.chinese: 六月。王入關，立太子。復如滎陽。
s734.literal: Sixth month. King entered the pass, established crown prince. Returned to Xingyang.
s734.idiomatic: Sixth month. King entered the pass, established crown prince. Returned to Xingyang.

s735.literal: Fifth. Han executed Han at Fei Qiu.
s735.idiomatic: Fifth. Han executed Han at Fei Qiu.

s756.chinese: 屬漢，為隴西、北地、中地郡。
s756.literal: Attached to Han, became Longxi, Beidi, Zhongdi commanderies.
s756.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Longxi, Beidi, Zhongdi commanderies.

s803.literal: Thirty-eighth. Han general Xin captured Bao.
s803.idiomatic: Thirty-eighth. Han general Xin captured Bao.

s824.literal: Attached to Han, became Hedong and Shangdang commanderies.
s824.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Hedong and Shangdang commanderies.

s834.literal: Twelfth. Han general Han Xin beheaded Chen Yu.
s834.idiomatic: Twelfth. Han general Han Xin beheaded Chen Yu.

s855.literal: Attached to Han, became Taiyuan commandery.
s855.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Taiyuan commandery.

s856.literal: Attached to Han, became a commandery.
s856.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became a commandery.

s875.chinese: 十二。布身降漢，地屬項籍。
s875.literal: Twelfth. Bu personally surrendered to Han, territory attached to Xiang Ji.
s875.idiomatic: Twelfth. Bu personally surrendered to Han, territory attached to Xiang Ji.

s965.literal: Fourth month. Chu besieged King at Xingyang.
s965.idiomatic: Fourth month. Chu besieged King at Xingyang.

s1042.literal: Linjiang King Huan. Beginning, Ao's son.
s1042.idiomatic: Linjiang King Huan. Beginning, Ao's son.

s1049.literal: Eighth month. Zhou Ke and Cong Gong killed Wei Bao.
s1049.idiomatic: Eighth month. Zhou Ke and Cong Gong killed Wei Bao.

s1103.chinese: 十一。漢將韓信破殺龍且。
s1103.literal: Eleventh. Han general Han Xin defeated and killed Long Ju.
s1103.idiomatic: Eleventh. Han general Han Xin defeated and killed Long Ju.

s1107.literal: Zhao King Zhang Er beginning, Han established him.
s1107.idiomatic: Zhao King Zhang Er beginning, Han established him.

s1109.chinese: 二十一。漢將韓信擊殺廣。
s1109.literal: Twenty-first. Han general Han Xin attacked and killed Guang.
s1109.idiomatic: Twenty-first. Han general Han Xin attacked and killed Guang.

s1130.literal: Attached to Han, became a commandery.
s1130.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became a commandery.

s1172.literal: Qi King Han Xin beginning, Han established him.
s1172.idiomatic: Qi King Han Xin beginning, Han established him.

s1175.literal: Second month. Established Xin as King of Qi.
s1175.idiomatic: Second month. Established Xin as King of Qi.

s1187.literal: Third. Han censor Zhou Ke entered Chu, died.
s1187.idiomatic: Third. Han censor Zhou Ke entered Chu, died.

s1196.literal: Third month. Zhou Ke entered Chu.
s1196.idiomatic: Third month. Zhou Ke entered Chu.

s1217.literal: Fourth month. King left Xingyang. Bao died.
s1217.idiomatic: Fourth month. King left Xingyang. Bao died.

s1274.literal: Huainan King Ying Bu beginning, Han established him.
s1274.idiomatic: Huainan King Ying Bu beginning, Han established him.

s1280.literal: Seventh month. Established Bu as Huainan King.
s1280.idiomatic: Seventh month. Established Bu as Huainan King.

s1322.literal: Ninth month. Taigong and Empress Lü returned from Chu.
s1322.idiomatic: Ninth month. Taigong and Empress Lü returned from Chu.

s1397.literal: Qi King Han Xin transferred to Chu King.
s1397.idiomatic: Qi King Han Xin transferred to Chu King.

s1399.literal: Attached to Han, became Nanhai commandery.
s1399.idiomatic: Attached to Han, became Nanhai commandery.

s1403.chinese: 十二。徙王楚，屬漢，為四郡。
s1403.literal: Twelfth. Transferred king to Chu, attached to Han, became four commanderies.
s1403.idiomatic: Twelfth. Transferred king to Chu, attached to Han, became four commanderies.

s1406.chinese: 正月。。殺項籍，天下平，諸侯臣屬漢。
s1406.literal: First month. Killed Xiang Ji, world pacified, lords became subjects of Han.
s1406.idiomatic: First month. Killed Xiang Ji, world pacified, lords became subjects of Han.

s1410.literal: Fifth year, first month. Yan kingdom.
s1410.idiomatic: Fifth year, first month. Yan kingdom.

s1414.chinese: 四。韓王信徙王代，都馬邑。
s1414.literal: Fourth. Han King Xin transferred to Dai king, capital at Mayi.
s1414.idiomatic: Fourth. Han King Xin transferred to Dai king, capital at Mayi.

s1415.literal: Divided Linjiang to form Changsha kingdom.
s1415.idiomatic: Divided Linjiang to form Changsha kingdom.

s1427.chinese: 二月。甲午，王更號，即皇帝位於定陶。
s1427.literal: Second month. Jiawu day, king changed title, took emperor position at Dingtao.
s1427.idiomatic: Second month. Jiawu day, king changed title, took emperor position at Dingtao.

s1436.chinese: 衡山王吳芮為為長沙王。
s1436.literal: Hengshan King Wu Rui became Changsha King.
s1436.idiomatic: Hengshan King Wu Rui became Changsha King.

s1511.literal: Sixth month. Emperor entered the pass.
s1511.idiomatic: Sixth month. Emperor entered the pass.

s1527.literal: Ninth. Er passed away, posthumous title King Jing.
s1527.idiomatic: Ninth. Er passed away, posthumous title King Jing.

s1541.literal: Sixth. Passed away, posthumous title King Wen.
s1541.idiomatic: Sixth. Passed away, posthumous title King Wen.

s1548.literal: Zhao King Zhang Ao beginning, Er's son.
s1548.idiomatic: Zhao King Zhang Ao beginning, Er's son.

s1553.literal: Eighth month. Emperor personally led troops to execute Yan.
s1553.idiomatic: Eighth month. Emperor personally led troops to execute Yan.

s1562.literal: Changsha King Cheng Chen beginning, Rui's son.
s1562.idiomatic: Changsha King Cheng Chen beginning, Rui's son.

s1565.chinese: 九。王得故項羽將鍾離辚，斬之以聞。
s1565.literal: Ninth. King obtained former Xiang Yu general Zhongli Mei, executed him to report.
s1565.idiomatic: Ninth. King obtained former Xiang Yu general Zhongli Mei, executed him to report.

s1578.literal: Ninth. Rebelled against Han, captured Shu.
s1578.idiomatic: Ninth. Rebelled against Han, captured Shu.

s1599.literal: Yan King Lu Wan beginning, Han grand marshal.
s1599.idiomatic: Yan King Lu Wan beginning, Han grand marshal.
